text: The page field does this now, but there is no way to validate that the page a content editor selects is a post or not. In the code, you can ensure there is a content group ID associated with that content object.

Yeah, still not great though. That would be fine for a developer or someone who knows what they’re doing, but with content editors it can be a different story. Just adding safeguards/warnings in the code, I don’t think is enough, it could still lead to confusion. I think it would be nice if there was a Blog post specific field. Or maybe add an option to the Page field to limit the options to only Website pages or Blog posts, and if doing that, maybe also add an option to limit choices to a specific domain (if choosing Website pages), or a specific Blog (if choosing Blog posts).

This did make me remember some of the reasons why I hate the Page field though.
I’m glad you hear my pain and have taken note, but it’s been over a year and a quarter later, and that pain has festered… Luckily it’s only my arm, but I would prefer not to have to amputate. :(
I should also say, this goes for the Page, Link, and URL fields as well; it uses the same dropdown I assume, and has the same limitations.
